intro: Ornithogalum naxense, commonly known as the Naxos star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to dry, warm climates. Ornithogalum naxense is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
